userStories.title: Add priority field to tasks table
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to add a priority field (low, medium, high) to the tasks table in the database so that tasks can be categorized by importance.
acceptanceCriteria: A migration is created to add a 'priority' enum column to the 'tasks' table
The enum values are: 'low', 'medium', 'high'
The default priority for new tasks is 'medium'
The migration can be rolled back cleanly
All existing tests must pass

userStories.title: Update Task model to include priority field
userStories.description: As a developer, I need to update the Task model to include the priority field in its fillable attributes and ensure proper casting.
acceptanceCriteria: The 'priority' field is added to the $fillable array
The Task model properly handles the priority enum
The model returns the correct priority value when accessed
All existing tests must pass

userStories.title: Add priority validation to task creation API
userStories.description: As a backend developer, I need to add validation for the priority field when creating or updating tasks through the API.
acceptanceCriteria: A form request is created or updated to validate the priority field
The priority field is optional during creation (defaults to 'medium')
Only valid enum values ('low', 'medium', 'high') are accepted
Appropriate error messages are returned for invalid values
API tests are added to verify validation

userStories.title: Display priority indicator in task list
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want to see a visual indicator of task priority in the task list so I can quickly identify important tasks.
acceptanceCriteria: A priority badge is displayed on each task card
The badge color matches the priority: red (high), yellow (medium), green (low)
The badge shows the priority text ('High', 'Medium', 'Low')
The UI is responsive and works on both iOS and Android
The component is properly typed with TypeScript

userStories.title: Add priority selector to task creation form
userStories.description: As a mobile user, I want to select a priority level when creating a new task so I can categorize its importance.
acceptanceCriteria: A priority selector (dropdown or segmented control) is added to the create task form
The selector shows all three priority options
The default selection is 'Medium'
The selected priority is sent to the API when creating the task
The UI follows the app's design system
